alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monroe County through 830 PM EDT... At 745 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Milan to near Britton to near Morenci. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Milan around 755 PM EDT. Dundee around 800 PM EDT. Maybee around 805 PM EDT. Carleton and Ottawa Lake around 815 PM EDT. Petersburg around 820 PM EDT. Lambertville around 825 PM EDT. Temperance, Ida and Luna Pier around 830 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Newport, Cone, Estral Beach, Erie, South Rockwood, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, Bolles Harbor, Samaria and Azalia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan.
